Review.Titre: i bought headphones for my son
Review.Contenu: i bought headphones for my son.  2 or 3 weeks in they stopped working. spoke to Ed in customer service. they sent a new pair.  didn’t work.  model number was the same as the first set.    Ed sent another. they worked for again about a month or so.  and the replacement set crapped out. i will do my feet to avoid your products at all cost and have shared my experience with family and friends.

Son’s headset split just shy of 10m of having the product.  I took them back to GAME who said that TB don’t class this damage as a warranty claim, only issues like the mic not working you can claim, so I told them to recycle them.  I then contacted TB, who to be fair did get back to me, but said they can’t replace unless I have the headset, which I don’t and told them I didn’t, a pic and receipt is not good enough apparently.  These cost £100.  Bad customer service, go for another brand if you want a quality product.After the reply from TB, maybe they should educate the retailers of their products that damage like this IS covered therefore would be able to send the item back.TB- He’s purchased a much better set from a better brand with better costumer service than you.

I purchased a rather expensive Turtlebeach headset for my Xbox One console, after about 2 months the wire with the headphone jack attached came off making the headset non-functional.  I was  completely unable to find any working UK contact numbers online for this company. I came across 2 numbers (one of them rang through and the other did not connect). The only way to have the item repaired is to submit a form online which I did roughly 2 weeks ago, it took them 6 days to reply to my E-Mail asking for further information. Over a week later I have still not heard anything back from them after trying my hardest to speak to someone concerning this.  My 3 month warranty is about to run out and I fear I will not be able to have my headset replaced.  I certainly will never buy a Turtlebeach product again.

Review.Titre: Stealth_600X_Gen2_Black bad choice for Xbox Series X

I will not recommend your equipment to anybody, sorry for that but I found that a cheap wireless Chinese headphone ($40) works much much better than your Stealth_600X_Gen2_Black with the Xbox Series X, and that is not acceptable.

It is like a vice on your head, the fake leather on the ear cups is disgusting and hard, adding to the discomfort.Turtle Beach have my money and that's fine but hopefully this review makes sure enough people don't buy their awful products that they lose out on more than the money they conned me out of.Avoid if you want to save time and money, cheers.

Review.Titre: To anyone thinking of buying Turtle…
Review.Contenu: To anyone thinking of buying Turtle Beach I have one word - don't. The reason being is simple - they're very cheaply made with cheap materials. I had my elite pro headphones little over six months before they started falling apart and I've had to return them to be replaced. Fortunately, they offer a two year manufacturer warranty but that warranty doesn't reset when I receive my new headphones. I play online and have plenty of friends that also have the elite pro headphones and have also had the same problem. Also, if you search for Turtle Beach on Twitter you'll see many others with the same problem. I wouldn't be so bothered if it was a £30 product, but it's a £150 product and you expect more for your money. Clearly, it's a cheaply made product. While I'm happy TB are replacing my headphones for a new pair, I've already made my mind up that I'll never be buying from this brand again. I'll probably buy Sennheisers in future, as it's a brand I trust that's been making headphones for a lot longer than Turtle Beach. I made a mistake buying these headphones, don't make the same mistake I did.

Review.Contenu: Well, after my 2nd set of Elite Atlas Aero Wireless PC gaming headsets.. I am done with the Turtle Beach Brand. My 1st pair was in 2020, and then I got the same pair in June of 2022. Why do these plastic headphones cost $100? There are major design flaws here. After 9 months both sides of the headphones have snapped (cause you pull on them to put them on your head...) and the usb port is breaking and they're a pain to charge.Add a way to power these things with a cable as well. The low battery notification comes about 1 minute before they shut down and when you're in a raid and cant plug them in you're screwed. I have to plug them in every night or they die from about 2 hours of game play. Battery does not last 8 hours.Sound quality isn't anything special. They are uncomfortable on the ear after an hour. Thankfully these were a gift. Not a recommended buy.

These are my genuine thoughts as someone who has excellent knowledge and experience in audio in general and who has tried and tested so many gaming headsets. GOOD:The headset is somewhat comfortable with plush memory foam ear pads. But it does have some clamping force, so if you’re someone who has a large head don’t even bother as it will literally give you headaches. MEDIOCRE:Turtle Beach Audio App is ok when it works and there seems to be a lot of bugs with it. Bluetooth disconnects randomly and the options you have in the app is not anything great. BAD:Whilst the sound quality in general is just ok, all this marketing about competitive headset is definitely rubbish. This headset is nothing like their old Elite Pro 2. Although that headset is wired, but the sound quality and superhuman hearing was great. With the 700 Gen 2 headset it’s awful and I do not recommend it to anyone who cares about critical sounds like footsteps and any other subtle sounds in FPS games, especially Warzone. This headset would be worth it at £80 and there are much better wireless headsets out there. I really hope they’ll make an Elite Pro 2 wireless version someday, but they really need stop with this app support and maybe introduce a desktop dac option like SteelSeries.
Pay through PayPal, at least then you're protected.

First time buyer directly from Turtle Beach website. Customer support takes a very long time to reply to emails. I appreciate the Covid-19 outbreak has affected lots of operations in most businesses. However, I can't see the number of emails received by Turtle Beach to be that much to cause delays like a whole 10 days or more to address customer issues. The other problem I experienced was whoever read my emails and I'm guessing a different person each time, was not reading properly and replied with requests that was already in my emails. Then another issue was lack of communication between their depot and customer service. I mean after all it's a retail company that sells products aimed at one particular market, so how hard could it be and it's not like it's the biggest company in the world with 100 different departments. You get the picture. Of course this was my experience as someone who purchased from TB for the first time and I value experience therefore, I would not purchase from their website again. The only reason I didn't give just one star is, I can recommend their Elite Pro 2 headset with amp easily to anyone. It's awesome and with the superhuman hearing it's ridiculously accurate with imaging, especially when playing FPS games. Only 2 downsides for me were lots of wires running across my living room floor, which was a death trap and the Bluetooth connection was quite unreliable. So if you're a desk gamer and TB makes their Bluetooth connection with the TB hub app more reliable then I can easily recommend. If you're a living room gamer then go for one of TB wireless options. But I would highly recommend to purchase from somewhere like Amazon as they usually price products cheaper than official sites and their return process is amazingly easy or simply if you haven't got a budget and ok with spending around £250-£300 then go for the SteelSeries Arctis Pro with game DAC or Pro Wireless. Omg they're simply the best.

Headphones simply stopped working one day. I arranged a replacement quite easily and then the trouble began. Once they received my headphones I had no further updates. I waited 3 weeks and emailed them to be told my replacement had been shipped that day.. nothing came. Each time I emailed to chase up my replacement I would have to wait three days to be given the same reply. Your replacement was shipped today, if it doesn't come by Friday let us know and we will ship another... This went on for three months. Finally I had enough and asked for the details of someone else I could talk to. Waited three days for the reply, this time they said they had shipped my replacement that day but they also provided a tracking number with UPS.I highly doubt I was sent six pairs of headphones that all got lost in the mail. These people lie to you and lead you on for as long as they can get away with it. Will never buy from them again.Update - When I finally received my replacement it was an almost like for like exchange. I just wish they had been straight with me and said it would take a couple of months.

Firstly the stealth pro headset is probably one of the best wireless headsets I've used it sounds fantastic you can pinpoint footsteps and even gun reloads, I would advise anyone that uses it on PC to download the audio hub software because it completely changes the sound from fantastic to out of this world you have a customizable EQ mix between game chat and game audio you can save profiles.The mic is good and can be customized via the audio hub to mute the mic just flip it up and you'll get an audio cue to confirm its muted. The noise cancelation isn't great because when you have it maxed out you will get a buzzing noise so I'd advise to not go above 50%. The battery life is what made this a 4 star review because they say 12 hours per battery but in reality it's around 9 hours. So would I  recommend these? Yes I would they're very good.

Had a Turtle Beach Stealth 600 Gen 2 Wireless headset which cracked and subsequently broke on the headband right above the earmuff.  I contacted Turtle Beach and received a prompt response to my inquiry about a damaged headset.  I was instructed to take a photo of the headset with a reference number and a photo of the serial number on the head band. Once that was submitted a replacement headset would be sent.  My original headset was black and green, but I was informed that I would not receive the same headset, I would receive an artic camo.  Replacement headset was received, and it was a reconditioned headset based upon the paperwork within the packaging.  Currently I have no known issues with the replacement headset.  My only complaint is the color of the replacement headset, white and gray and how long it will remain that color.  I would have rated 5 stars if I would have received the same color headset. Process from start to finish, less than two weeks.

The baseline product is great in itself. Unfortunately mine had some issues but the support team hooked me up with helpful instructions on hard resetting the headset and when that failed they replaced my headset entirely. Over all a painless experience and I’m now enjoying the functional product.

Purchased a pair of Stealth 700 Gen two for my son in July 22. A week ago they broke, so I contacted Turtle Beach as they gave a two year warranty. They looked at the photos and asked me to inform Amazon that they had authorised an exchange under the warranty scheme. I contacted Amazon and thats where it became difficult, as the call centre was in India, it was difficult trying to explain to them. They just kept telling me that the 30 day return window had expired and that they could not exchange. I kept going around the houses with them, making no progress. Frustrated, I contacted Turtle Beach and explained my disappointment. Without hesitation Turtle Beach authorised delivery from their own warehouse of a replacement headset. The headset arrived this morning and is the latest version of the model we purchased last year. This is how customer service should be. Turtle Beach clearly care about their reputation and value their customers. Thank you Turtle Beach Customer Service.
